items.title: What to Know About the Boulder, Colorado, Attack and Suspect
items.description: Eight people in Boulder, Colo., were burned after a man threw Molotov cocktails in an attack that he had planned for a year, the authorities said.

items.title: Consumers Are Financing Their Groceries. What Does It Say About the Economy?
items.description: Increased use of “buy now, pay later” loans may signal shifting consumer habits, but could also be a troubling sign of financial stress.

items.title: In Drone Attacks on Russia, Ukraine Aims for Strategic and Symbolic Blow
items.description: While the full extent of the damage is still unknown, the operation shows how Kyiv has been able to adapt and evolve over the war using drones.

items.title: Why Politics Feels So Cruel Right Now
items.description: Three Opinion writers on the death of empathy in America.

items.title: What if Google Just Broke Itself Up? A Tech Insider Makes the Case.
items.description: Prosecutors aren’t the only ones arguing for a smaller Google. Some critics say it might be better for investors, customers and innovation.
